result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R. Mercier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $2,821.16 plus surcharges.
Spend 120 days in the county jail, commencing 3/5/16 @ 8am.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Not eligible for electronic leg monitor.  Credit for 8 days served.  May not have contact with Dorothy Parker, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber and work crew privileges authorized.  Not eligible for electronic leg monitor.  Credit for 8 days served.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas R. Mercier, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made and 14CF1308 & 15CF1082 read in.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 3/5/16 at 8:00 AM and DE is given credit for 8 days.  Sentence is concurrent with 14CF1412.   DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $2821.16 per stipulation between parties.  Sentence is concurrent to 14CF1412.   Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs and Cash Bond on Deposit between files 14CF1412, 14CF1308 and 15CF1082 are to be applied.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Dorothy P. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights given.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

Sentencing 2/25/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.
